text_blocks:
Where is Lake Ci?
Lake Ci is located at the northwest corner of Kinmen. The original place is the entrance of Lake Shuangli (Two Carps). In 1969, Ma An-Lan, the commander of the Kinmen Defense Command, initiated construction of the lake and finished it the following year. Lake Ci’s causeway was also built with a view to combine war-preparedness, transportation, and people’s livelihood.

What is the significance of Lake Ci?
Lake Ci’s causeway is also called the Great Wall Bridge. It measures about 550m in length and connects Jincheng city and Guningtou village. Separating Lake Ci and the sea, the causeway makes the lake half saltwater and half fresh water. The lake’s waterway leads directly to the sea, and fish and shrimp are so abundant that many fishermen will gather here.

What kinds of natural species can we see around Lake Ci? Around Lake Ci are wetlands with fish farms, swamps, trees, and so on, making this the largest habitat for migratory birds in Kinmen. Inside the bird-watching area, different species of birds gather and form an ideal place for bird ecology as well as one of the best bird-watching spots in Kinmen. The bird species of Lake Ci normally include cormorants, goose- ducks, storks, ibis, and many others.

Lake Ci faces Little Kinmen and Mainland China across the sea. Besides bird-watching, visitors can also catch a glimpse of Little Kinmen and the Mainland. At dusk, taking a walk and viewing the sea is most favorable and highly enjoyable. Accompanied by the whispering waves and the starry night sky when there is little light interference, couples cannot help but enjoy a stroll around Lake Ci with their date.

Where is Old Wen Tai Pagoda?
Old Wei Tai Pagoda is located on the southeast side of Jinmencheng (also called Old Jincheng). It’s a five-storied hexagonal construction made of granite and was built in 1387 during the Ming Dynasty, over 600 years ago. The pagoda has been rated a national historic relic.

Is it the only pagoda in Kinmen?
Kinmen had three large pagodas in its history, including Taiwu Mountain’s Daoying Pagoda, Shuitou Village’s Maoshan Pagoda, and Jinmencheng’s Old Wen Tai Pagoda. They all functioned as lighthouses for sailors in the nearby sea. The Daoying Pagoda on Taiwu Mountain was destroyed in 1918 by an earthquake, while the Maoshan Pagoda in Shuitou village was ruined in 1961 during the August 23rd Bombardment. Fortunately, Old Wen Tai Pagoda survived the other two, and is now well-preserved. The two towers that were destroyed have been reconstructed.

What is written on the huge rock near Old Wen Tai Pagoda? On this huge rock near Old Wen Tai Pagoda are four characters: “Xu Jian Xiao Wo” written by Yu, Da-You, a general of the Ming Dynasty during his tour of duty in Kinmen.
What was the function of the three pagodas?
It’s said that the pagodas were used for sailors’ safety, and were considered the guardian angels of the sailors. The pagodas were just like lighthouses for the navigators. When they were seen in a line, the navigators could easily locate the island of Kinmen, without mistaking it for the mainland of China. Besides that, they were also thought of as “feng-shui pagodas” where people prayed for good fortune.
